            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Ready to graduate?</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>You’re ready to graduate! You've pulled the all-nighters, scheduled the study groups and written so many term papers that your laptop is about to short circuit. But before you can walk on stage and get your diploma, there are a couple of things you have to do first:</p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="apply-now"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Apply to graduate">
					<div class="lbl">1</div>
                    Apply to graduate
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>When you’re nearing the completion of your degree, you must apply to graduate before the specified <b>deadline</b>:</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table  ">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th>&nbsp;</th>
<th>Semester*</th>
<th>Deadline</th>
<th>Convocation date</th>
</tr><tr><td><i>*The semester you <br>
 complete&nbsp;your degree <br>
 requirements</i></td>
<td>Winter</td>
<td>January 15</td>
<td>Spring</td>
</tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td>
<td>Summer</td>
<td>July 15</td>
<td>Fall</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>How to apply to graduate:</p>
<ol>
<li>Login to <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a></li>
<li>Select &nbsp;<i>Student Services</i></li>
<li>Select <i>Graduation Application Form</i></li>
</ol>
<p>Please take note:</p>
<ul>
<li>Don’t wait until you have received your grades or have defended your thesis before submitting your application!</li>
<li>We accept late applications only for a limited period. We also charge a fee for late applications.</li>
<li>If you do not complete your degree requirements by the end of the appropriate semester you must reapply during the following semester.</li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="account"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Clear your account">
					<div class="lbl">2</div>
                    Clear your account
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Check your account and be sure to pay any outstanding fees, including library fees, before the <b>deadline</b>:</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table  ">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th>Convocation</th>
<th>Deadline to settle account</th>
</tr><tr><td>Fall 2013</td>
<td>Monday, November 11, 2013</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<ul>
<li><a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/fee-payment-deadlines/methods-of-payment.html" adhocenable="false">See acceptable methods of payment</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="approval"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Check approval status">
					<div class="lbl">3</div>
                    Check approval status
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_1" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>We will post your graduation approval status starting:</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table  ">
    <table width="50%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th style="text-align: center;">Monday, November 11, 2013</th>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Check your student record via the MyConcordia portal to see your approval status. Your graduation is confirmed when the&nbsp;<b>Degree Conferred</b>&nbsp;message appears on your student record.</p>
<p>How to check your approval status:</p>
<ol>
<li>Log on to <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a>.</li>
<li>Select<b>&nbsp;&quot;</b>Academic&quot; from the top of the MyConcordia menu.</li>
<li>Select<b>&nbsp;&quot;</b>Student Record&quot;.</li>
<li>Once you access your student record, scroll down until you see a box with the heading, &quot;Program Status&quot;.</li>
<li>Look for the message <b>Degree Conferred</b>. This message indicates that your graduation has been confirmed!</li>
</ol>
<blockquote>If you do not see the Degree Conferred message on the indicated date, please contact the Office of the Registrar/Enrolment Services at (514) 848-2424 ext. 2668.</blockquote>
<p>Once you’re approved for graduation, it’s time to <a adhocenable="false" href="/students/graduation/convocation.html">get ready for Convocation</a>!</p>
<p>Not attending Convocation? Here’s how to <a adhocenable="false" href="/students/graduation/pick-up-replacement-diplomas.html">pick up your diploma</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    
    <div class="container">

<ul class="c-breadcrumb breadcrumb">

	        <li>
                <a href="/" onclick="CQ_Analytics.record({event:'followBreadcrumb',values: { breadcrumbPath: '/content/concordia/en' },collect: false,options: { obj: this },componentPath: 'concordia/components/breadcrumb'})">
                    Home
                </a>
	        </li>
	        &nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;
	        <li>
                <a href="/students.html" onclick="CQ_Analytics.record({event:'followBreadcrumb',values: { breadcrumbPath: '/content/concordia/en/students' },collect: false,options: { obj: this },componentPath: 'concordia/components/breadcrumb'})">
                    Students
                </a>
	        </li>
	        &nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;
	        <li>
                <a href="/students/records.html" onclick="CQ_Analytics.record({event:'followBreadcrumb',values: { breadcrumbPath: '/content/concordia/en/students/records' },collect: false,options: { obj: this },componentPath: 'concordia/components/breadcrumb'})">
                    Studying in Quebec
                </a>
	        </li>
	        
</ul></div>

    </div>

</header>

    <div class="container">

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>Studying in Quebec</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Quebec regulations that affect tuition</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>All Concordia students, and all university students in Quebec, must register at least once with the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.mesrst.gouv.qc.ca/">Ministère de l'Enseignement supérieur, de la Recherche, de la Science et de la Technologie</a>&nbsp;(MESRST). We can help you with the following tasks, because they affect the tuition you will pay at Concordia:&nbsp;</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Register or obtain a permanent code: </b>all Concordia students must have one, given to them by the MESRST.&nbsp;</li>
<li><b>Qualify for Quebec tuition rates</b>: Only certain students pay Quebec tuition rates. Your qualifcation for this depends on you satisfying MESRST guidelines. &nbsp;</li>
</ul>
<p>It's important that you read these sections and follow the guidelines provided so you can benefit from one, or both, of these conditions for studying in Quebec.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Permanent code requirement">
					
                    Permanent code requirement
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b style="font-size: 12px;">Every student studying at a Quebec University</b><span style="font-size: 12px;">&nbsp;must have a permanent code or <i>code permanent.&nbsp;</i></span>This code is assigned by the Ministry. Concordia needs you to have a permanent code. Without one, you will pay an extra differential tuition fee.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/permanent-code.html">Learn more about your permanent code<br>
&nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Quebec Resident Tuition Status">
					
                    Quebec Resident Tuition Status
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><span style="font-size: 12px;">International students, Canadian Citizens and Permanent Residents in Undergraduate and Graduate programs at Concordia pay higher tuition fees than Quebec residents. </span></p>
<p><span style="font-size: 12px;">To pay <b>Quebec resident tuition fees</b>, you must qualify as a Quebec resident under MESRST definitions.&nbsp;</span></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/quebec-residency.html">Learn how to qualify and register for Quebec resident tuition status</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open French Program Fee Exemption">
					
                    French Program Fee Exemption
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_1" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><span style="font-size: 12px;">If you do not qualify for Quebec Resident Tuition Status (as outlined above), you normally have to pay additional tuition fees. However, <b>if you register in approved French programs or courses, these fees maybe waived.</b></span></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/french-program-exemptions.html">Learn about French program fee exemptions</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open International Fee Exemptions">
					
                    International Fee Exemptions
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_2" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><span style="font-size: 12px;">Some international students qualify for Quebec tuition fee rates under MESRST rgulations. See if you qualify.</span></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/international-fee-exemptions.html">Learn more about International fee exemptions</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase textimage section">



<div class="image " id="cq-textimage-jsp-/content/concordia/en/students/records/jcr:content/sidebar/textimage" style="width:auto;"><img title="related-office-63x50" alt="related-office-63x50" class="cq-dd-image" src="/students/records/_jcr_content/sidebar/textimage/image.img.png/1383929140531.png"></div>

        var imageEvars = '{ imageLink: "/", imageAsset: "/content/dam/common/icons/63x50/related-office-63x50.png", imageTitle: "related\x2Doffice\x2D63x50" }';
        var tagNodes = imageDiv.getElementsByTagName('A');
        for (var i = 0; i < tagNodes.length; i++) {
            var link = tagNodes.item(i); 
            link.setAttribute('onclick', 'CQ_Analytics.record({event: "imageClick", values: ' + imageEvars + ', collect:  false, options: { obj: this }, componentPath: "concordia/components/textimage"})');
        }
        
    })();
</script>
        <div class="rte"><div class="text"><h3>Connect with us</h3>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/offices/registrar.html">Office of the Registrar</a></p>
</div></div>
<div class="clear"></div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>

        </div>

    </div>

<div class="c-quicklinks" >

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

	        <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Course registration</h1>
</div></div>
<div class="section tabs">










    <script type="text/javascript">
	$ = jQuery;
	$(document).ready(function() {
	    $('#tabs a:first').tab('show');
	    var hash = window.location.hash;
	    if (hash == undefined || hash == ""){
	      var previouslyActive = getCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab");
          if (previouslyActive != undefined) hash = previouslyActive;
	    }
	    hash && $('ul.nav a[href="' + hash + '"]').tab('show');

	    $('.nav-tabs a').click(function (e) {
	        $(this).tab('show');
	        var scrollmem = $('body').scrollTop();
	        window.location.hash = this.hash;
	        $('html,body').scrollTop(scrollmem);
	        setCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab", this.hash, 1);
	    });
	});
        /** COOKIE GETTER AND SETTER FUNCTIONS **/
    function setCookie(c_name,value,exdays){
        var exdate=new Date();
        exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate() + exdays);
        var c_value=escape(value) + ((exdays==null) ? "" : "; expires="+exdate.toUTCString());
        document.cookie=c_name + "=" + c_value;
    }
    function getCookie(c_name){
      var c_value=document.cookie;
      var c_start=c_value.indexOf(" " + c_name + "=");
      if (c_start == -1)	{
        c_start=c_value.indexOf(c_name + "=");
      }
      if (c_start == -1){
        c_value=null;
      } else {
        c_start=c_value.indexOf("=", c_start) + 1;
        var c_end=c_value.indexOf(";", c_start);
        if (c_end == -1){
          c_end=c_value.length;
        }
        c_value=unescape(c_value.substring(c_start,c_end));
      }
      return c_value;
    }
	</script>
	
	<div class="c-tabs">
    
	    <ul class="nav nav-tabs" id="tabs">
	        
		          <li><a href="#undergraduate" data-toggle="tab">Undergraduate</a></li>
		        
	        
		          <li><a href="#graduate" data-toggle="tab">Graduate</a></li>
		        
	        
	    </ul>
	    <div class="tab-content">
	        <div class="tab-pane" id="undergraduate">
	           
	           <div class="parsys parsys-tabs-0">


<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt1"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt1-c0 span9"><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3>How to register in a few easy steps:</h3>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><a name="top"></a></p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#step1">Step 1 — Academic Advising</a></li>
<li><a href="#step2">Step 2 — Organize Your Registration Materials</a></li>
<li><a href="#step3">Step 3 — Plan Your Timetable and Complete the Registration Worksheet</a></li>
<li><a href="#step4">Step 4 — Registration Start Date</a></li>
<li><a href="#step5">Step 5 — Registration System Availability</a></li>
<li><a href="#step6">Step 6 — Registration</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/registration.html#step7">Step 7 — How to Obtain Help</a></li>
<li><a href="#step8">Step 8 — Verify Your Schedule</a></li>
<li><a href="#step9">Step 9 — Obtain Your Account Balance and Verify Payment Deadlines</a></li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li><a href="/students/registration/reading-course-listings.html" adhocenable="false">How to Read the Course Listings</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/registration/term-dates-deadlines.html" adhocenable="false">Term Dates and Deadlines</a></li>
<li><a href="/maps.html" adhocenable="false">Campus Maps</a></li>
<li><a href="/students/birks/student-id.html" adhocenable="false">Student I.D. Cards</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="step1"></a>Step 1 — Academic Advising</h3>
<p>The requirements for advising prior to registration vary according to your program of study. To determine if you require advising, go to your Faculty or School's advising information page by clicking on the appropriate link below.<br>
<br>
Remember that if you are required to meet with an adviser before registering, you will not have access to the Web Registration System until you do so.</p>
<p><b>Faculty Advising Information:</b></p>
<table border="0" width="300">
<tbody><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><b><a href="/students/registration/advising/artsandscience-advising.html" adhocenable="false">Arts and Science</a></b></td>
</tr><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/students/registration/advising/johnmolson-advising.html" adhocenable="false">John Molson School of Business</a></b></td>
</tr><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><b><a href="/students/registration/advising/encs-advising.html" adhocenable="false">Engineering and Computer Science</a></b></td>
</tr><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/students/registration/advising/finearts-advising.html" adhocenable="false">Fine Arts</a></b></td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="step2"></a>Step 2 — Organize your registration materials</h3>
<p>In order to access the Web Registration System (<a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia</a>&nbsp;portal), you will need your Netname and password, your student ID number, which is on your Letter of Acceptance (new students) or your Concordia record (returning students).<br>
<br>
The&nbsp;<a href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar.html" adhocenable="false">Undergraduate Calendar</a>&nbsp;is useful if you wish to see a course description or verify program requirements.<br>
<br>
You should prepare for your registration by consulting the&nbsp;<a href="http://fcms.concordia.ca/fcms/asc002_stud_all.aspx">Undergraduate Class Schedule</a>&nbsp;and by filling out the Registration Worksheet and Timetable Planner available below as PDF files. Please note during peak registration periods the system has a time limit of 30 minutes. Using these documents in advance will help you plan your course selection and enable you to save time.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="step3"></a>Step 3 — Plan Your Timetable and Complete the Registration Worksheet</h3>
<p>To facilitate the process and prepare a conflict-free schedule, we recommend you use a printed version of the&nbsp;<a href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/registrar/docs/registration/Regwrks.pdf" adhocenable="false">Registration Worksheet</a>&nbsp;and<i>&nbsp;</i><a href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/registrar/docs/registration/timeplan.pdf" adhocenable="false">Timetable Planner</a><i>.</i></p>
<p><i>Please note the following:</i><br>
<br>
<b>Time Conflict</b><br>
You will not be allowed to register for courses where any of the class hours (including labs, tutorials, etc.) overlap with another course. It is important to be prepared in advance with several different schedules and a list of replacement courses in case your original choices are not available.<br>
<br>
<b>Test results</b><br>
If you plan on registering for English Composition or ESL (English as a Second Language) courses and have written the appropriate placement test, you may obtain your test results at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a><br>
<br>
<b>Prerequisites</b><br>
Degree students: You are not permitted to register for a course that has a prerequisite if you have not completed that prerequisite. If you have received authorization from an academic adviser to register for a course without the stated prerequisite, the adviser must enter a waiver that will permit you access to the course. Independent and Visiting students who wish to register for courses where the prerequisite was completed elsewhere must complete a &quot;Prerequisite Waiver Form&quot; and receive approval prior to registering. This form is available at the&nbsp;<a href="/offices/birks.html" adhocenable="false">Birks Student Service Centre</a>.<br>
</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="step4"></a>Step 4 — Registration start dates*</h3>
<p><i>*A start date is the first date on which you may begin the registration process for both summer and Fall/Winter</i></p>
<p>If you are a returning Concordia student, your personal registration start date can be obtained on the student portal at MyConcordia.ca under the Registration tab.</p>
<p>If you are a returning student and wish to calculate your start date yourself, use the following formula:</p>
<p>Program length (Min. credits required) minus credits completed minus potential credits as of February 2013 (excluding DISC courses) equals credits to completion. Refer to example record below.</p>
<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="4">
<tbody><tr><td><br>
<table>
<tbody><tr><td><p>&nbsp;</p>
<table>
<tbody><tr><td width="400px">B.Comm. (M.E.P)</td>
<td width="250px">01/09/12</td>
</tr><tr><td>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Major &nbsp;Accountancy</td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr><tr><td>Min. Credits Required : 111.00</td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr><tr><td colspan="2">On Basis Of : MATURE ENTRY</td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr></tbody></table>
<br>
</td>
</tr><tr><td><table>
<tbody><tr><td colspan="9">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<u>Fall 12-13</u></td>
</tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr><tr><td width="260">INTRODUCTION TO MICROECONOMICS</td>
<td width="100">&nbsp;&nbsp;ECON 201</td>
<td width="30">/2</td>
<td width="30">AA</td>
<td width="45">3.00</td>
<td width="45">A-</td>
<td width="35">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="50">&nbsp;</td>
<td>3.00</td>
</tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td>
</tr><tr><td width="260">ENGLISH LANG-INTERMEDIATE I</td>
<td width="100">&nbsp;&nbsp;ESL 207</td>

<p><br>
In the example above: program length (Minimum credits required) is 111 credits&nbsp;<b>minus</b>&nbsp;12 credits completed&nbsp;<b>minus</b>&nbsp;12 potential credits&nbsp;<b>equals</b>&nbsp;87 credits to completion. Once you know the credits to completion, refer to the CHART OF REGISTRATION DATES to determine your start date.<br>

The information regarding the registration start date for newly admitted Concordia students is also located below.<br>

<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="step5"></a>Step 5 — Registration System Availability</h3>
<p>On the registration “start dates?, the system is programmed to be available from 6:00 a.m. onward. After your original “start date?, the system is available at all times, 22 hours a day, seven days a week, from 04:00 a.m. to 02:00 a.m. The registration system may be extremely busy at 6:00 a.m. on each new “start date? so it is strongly recommended that you wait until later in the day.<br>
<br>
In order to perform routine computer maintenance, the system will occasionally be unavailable on Saturday. If you are registering when the computer is scheduled to go down, you will be disconnected without warning. However, all confirmed transactions done to this point will be saved. We recommend you verify your registration status the next time you access the registration system.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="step6"></a>Step 6 — Registration</h3>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style="background-color: #F0F0F0 !important;  color: # !important;   padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: center;"><b>While departmental and faculty advisers and staff are always available to give advice and guidance, you are responsible for the completeness and correctness of your course selection and registration, and for observing the University's regulations and deadlines.</b></p>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<ol>
<li><b>Netname and Password Instructions</b><br>
Information regarding the use of a netname and password is available on the student portal at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a>.&nbsp;<b>For security reasons please keep your password confidential.<br>
 <br>
 </b></li>
<li><b>Program of Study Verification</b><br>
Once you have entered your netname and password, you will see your current program of study (<i>e.g.</i>&nbsp;BA, Major - Anthropology). If the information concerning your program is incorrect you may contact 514-848-2424 ext. 2668 to find out how to make corrections. It is important for this information to be correct, as the wrong degree or concentration may block you from entering courses for which you are eligible.<br>
<br>
</li>
<li><b>Address Verification</b><br>
On this screen, you will see your current address. Follow the instructions if you wish to correct your address, or continue to the next step. Please note you are responsible for providing the University with your current mailing address. You are required to fulfill all financial and administrative obligations within the prescribed deadlines regardless of the validity of your address in our files.<br>
<br>
</li>
<li><b>Registration Status</b><br>
On this screen, you will see a list of the courses for which you have already registered in the current academic year. Your options will be to add a course, make a section change, or drop a course.</li>
</ol>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase box section">









<div class="c-sidebar-calltoaction bloc link-color-dark " style="background-color: #F0F0F0 !important;  color: # !important;   padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">


    <h2 class="section-header" style='color: # !important; '></h2>
    <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: center;"><b>It is extremely important that you complete each transaction by using the confirmation button. Neglecting to do this will result in the transaction being cancelled.</b></p>

</div></div>


</div>



</div>

</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h5><b>Adding courses</b></h5>
<p>Choose &quot;add a course&quot; and select your course by entering the course name and number.</p>
<p>The course you selected will appear on a course search result screen. Additional information such as special topic, prerequisite(s), course notes and summer term dates are available by clicking the details button.</p>
<p>After you have selected the course to add, a confirmation of selection screen will ask you to confirm your selection.</p>
<p>Following confirmation, a screen will inform you if registration has been approved or denied. If registration is denied, a reason will be provided.</p>
<p>If a course has reached its registration limit, you will be offered the possibility to view other sections of that course that might be available to you. If there are none, select another course. Don't forget, however, that students will be adding and dropping courses throughout the year and places may become free. You will have ample opportunity to drop courses and make any other changes you wish. In addition, in mid-June, failed students are withdrawn from all courses by the University, thereby freeing space in courses. Remember to pay attention to the symbols beside the course name when reading the course listings; some courses will not normally have general space available, as they are reserved for students in specific programs, as explained in&nbsp;<a href="/students/registration/reading-course-listings.html" adhocenable="false">How to Read the Course Listings</a>.</p>
<p>If the section you selected is not available, you will see a list of other sections of that course that are open to you in the current or next term, if applicable.</p>
<p>If you are trying to add a course for the Winter Term and there is no more space, you will not be advised of available sections for the Fall Term. If the Fall Term has not started, however, you may wish to verify the possible availability of the same course in the Fall Term.</p>
<p>Remember to register for both Fall and Winter courses at the same time - do not wait until later in the Fall to register for your Winter courses as you may find them filled to capacity.</p>
<h5><b>Course section changes</b></h5>
<p>The section change function allows you to verify the availability of another section of the same course before you make a decision. There is, therefore, no risk of losing the section you have if another section is not available. DO NOT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, use the drop and add features to accomplish a section change. If you drop the section that you are currently registered for and then find out that no spaces are available in other sections, you may not be able to get back into the section you were originally registered in as another student may have taken your place once you dropped the course.</p>
<ol>
<li>Select &quot;Section Change&quot; next to the course in which you wish to make a change of section.</li>
<li>A screen will appear listing all other sections of the same course. If you find one you wish to enter, press the Change button.</li>
<li>Either confirm or cancel the action by clicking the appropriate button. If you cancel the action, you will be returned to the Results of Course Change Search screen. If you choose Confirm Change, the system will approve or deny the section change. If approved, you will be added to the section chosen and dropped from the other. Confirmation of the change will be displayed on the Course Section Change Approved screen. You will then be able to return to the Registration Status screen where the new section will be listed.</li>
</ol>
<p><b>Please note:</b>&nbsp;Once the last date for registration has passed, you may not make section changes.<br>
&nbsp;</p>
<h5><b>Dropping courses</b></h5>
<p>Please note:&nbsp;If you only want to change sections of the same course use the &quot;Section Change&quot; function.</p>
<p>Dropping a course means you have decided you no longer wish to remain registered in it. There are two types of course withdrawals and both are controlled by deadline dates shown in&nbsp;<a href="/students/registration/term-dates-deadlines.html" adhocenable="false">Term Dates and Deadlines</a>:<br>
</p>
<p><b>DNE (did not enter)</b>&nbsp;- The DNE date is generally one to two weeks after the first day of classes. A withdrawal (drop) before the DNE deadline date is treated as if you were never in the course. There will be no entry on your student record for that course and you will not be charged tuition and other fees for that course. If you have already paid for the course, you will receive financial credit for course fees.<br>
</p>
<p><b>DISC (discontinue)</b>&nbsp;- The DISC date is later in the term. A withdrawal (drop) after the DNE date, but before the DISC deadline date allows you to stop attending that course with no academic penalty. Unlike the DNE, however, the course will remain on your student record with an entry of DISC and you will be held financially responsible for the payment of 100% of tuition and other fees, including the Winter portion of a full-year course (/3).<br>
</p>
<p>If you attempt to DNE or DISC a course that is a corequisite or prerequisite to another course for which you have registered, you will not be permitted to do so until you also drop the second course.<br>
<br>
For example: you have registered for COMM 217/2 in the Fall term and COMM 305/4 in the Winter term. You are attempting to DISC COMM 217/2. You will not be able to do so until you DNE COMM 305/4. Once you have successfully DNE’d COMM 305, you may then drop COMM 217.</p>
<ol>
<li>Choose &quot;Drop&quot; next to the course you wish to drop.</li>
<li>Confirm the action. If your request to drop a course has been accepted a confirmation of course drop screen will appear showing the details and asking you to confirm your selection by clicking the &quot;Confirm Drop&quot; or &quot;Don't Drop&quot; button. You will be returned to the Registration Status screen where your course will no longer be shown if the course was dropped before the DNE deadline. After the DNE deadline and before the DISC deadline, the notation DISC will appear beside the course you have confirmed to drop.</li>
</ol>
<p><b>Please note:</b>&nbsp;Not attending classes, or informing an instructor of an intent to withdraw, does not constitute official withdrawal, nor does it entitle a student to a refund of fees or cancellation of registration. Without formally dropping the course by the appropriate academic withdrawal deadline, non-attendance of a class will result in the assignment of a failing grade.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>

<table border="0" width="300">
<tbody><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><b><a href="/students/registration/advising/artsandscience-advising.html" adhocenable="false">Arts and Science</a></b></td>
</tr><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/students/registration/advising/johnmolson-advising.html" adhocenable="false">John Molson School of Business</a></b></td>
</tr><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><b><a href="/students/registration/advising/finearts-advising.html" adhocenable="false">Engineering and Computer Science</a></b></td>
</tr><tr><td><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;»&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/students/registration/advising/encs-advising.html" adhocenable="false">Fine Arts</a></b></td>
</tr></tbody></table>
<p><br>
For non Faculty-related problems, please call (514) 848-2424, ext. 2668 Monday to Friday, from 09:00 – 17:00, all year round, except for holidays. Refer to&nbsp;<b><a adhocenable="false" href="#step4">Step 4 — Registration Start Date</a></b>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<b><a adhocenable="false" href="#step5">Step 5 — Registration System Availability</a></b>.</p>

</div></div>

    <div class="parsys">

<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt1"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt1-c0 span9"><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<ul>
<li><a href="#grad-step1" adhocenable="false">Step 1 — Academic Advising</a></li>

</ul>
<p><b>Only the students for the programs listed below have web registration access. For all other programs you will have to contact your&nbsp;<a href="http://graduatestudies.concordia.ca/forfacultystaff/gpdlist/">Graduate Program Assistant</a>&nbsp;for in-person registration.</b></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="grad-step1"></a>Step 1 — Academic Advising</h3>
<p>The requirements for advising prior to registration vary according to your program of study. To determine if you require advising, go to your Faculty or School’s advising information page by clicking on the appropriate link below.</p>
<p>Remember that if you are required to meet with an adviser before registering, you will not have access to the Web Registration System until you do so.</p>
<ul>
<li>You can also <a adhocenable="false" href="https://myconcordia.ca" target="_blank">view your degree audit</a> on the MyConcordia portal to verify your degree requirements<br>
<br>
</li>
<li>Faculty Advising Information and Registration Start Dates:&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/program-contacts.html" adhocenable="false">Find the right person to speak in your Graduate Program </a>for advising information<br>
&nbsp;</li>
</ul>
<h3>Arts and Science:</h3>
<p>MA Media Studies<br>
Diplôme en Traduction<br>
PhD Education&nbsp;<br>
MA Child Studies<br>
MA Educational Studies<br>
Diploma Adult Education&nbsp;<br>
MA Applied Linguistics<br>
MA Educational Technology<br>
Diploma Instructional Technology<br>
MSc Chemistry and Biochemistry</p>

<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="grad-step2"></a>Step 2 — Organize your Registration Materials</h3>
<p>In order to access the Web Registration System (<a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia</a>&nbsp;portal), you will need your Netname and password, your student ID number, which is on your Letter of Acceptance (new students) or your Concordia record (returning students).</p>
<p>The&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current.html" adhocenable="false">Graduate Calendar</a>&nbsp;is useful if you wish to see a course description or verify program requirements.</p>
<p>The list of available courses will appear on your registration screen. You can also prepare for your registration by consulting the&nbsp;<a href="http://fcms.concordia.ca/fcms/asc002_stud_all.aspx">Class Schedule</a>&nbsp;and your Degree Audit.</p>
<p>Please note during peak registration periods the system has a time limit of 30 minutes. Consulting these resources in advance will help you plan your course selection and enable you to save time.</p>
<p>Please note the following:</p>
<h3>Qualifying programs</h3>
<p>Qualifying program courses consist of deficiencies and/or additional course requirements that are not part of the degree program requirements but must be completed in order to graduate. You will not be permitted to register for your graduate program courses until you have registered for your qualifying program courses. All qualifying courses are to be completed in the first 3 terms following your term of admission. If your qualifying program course(s), listed in your letter of admission, are not specific please consult with your adviser to determine the required courses, prior to registration.</p>
<h3>Time Conflict</h3>
<p>You will not be allowed to register for courses where any of the class hours (including labs, tutorials, etc.) overlap with another course.</p>
<h3>English Language Requirements</h3>
<p>If you are required to register for ESL (English as a Second Language) courses and have written the appropriate placement test, you may obtain your test results at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a>.</p>
<h3>Prerequisites</h3>
<p>Degree students: You are not permitted to register for a course that has a prerequisite if you have not completed that prerequisite. If you have received authorization from an academic adviser to register for a course without the stated prerequisite, the adviser must enter a waiver that will permit you access to the course.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="grad-step3"></a>Step 3 — Registration System Availability</h3>
<p>On the registration “start dates?, the system is programmed to be available from 6:00 a.m. onward. After your original “start date?, the system is available at all times, 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The registration system may be extremely busy at 6:00 a.m. on each new “start date? so it is strongly recommended that you wait until later in the day.</p>
<p>In order to perform routine computer maintenance, the system will occasionally be unavailable. If you are registering when the computer is scheduled to go down, you will be disconnected without warning. However, all confirmed transactions done to this point will be saved. We recommend you verify your registration status the next time you access the registration system.</p>
<p>System unavailability is announced on&nbsp;<a href="http://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><a name="grad-step4"></a>Step 4 — Registration</h3>
<p>While advisers and staff are always available to give advice and guidance, you are responsible for the completeness and correctness of your course selection and registration, and for observing the University’s regulations and deadlines.</p>
<ul>
<li><h5><b>Netname and Password Instructions</b></h5>
<p>Information regarding the use of a netname and password is available on the student portal at&nbsp;<a href="http://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia.ca</a>.</p>
<p>For security reasons please keep your password confidential.</p>
</li>
<li><h5><b>Program of Study Verification</b></h5>
<p>Once you have entered your netname and password, you will see your current program of study (e.g.&nbsp;MA Media Studies). If the information concerning your program is incorrect you may contact&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/program-contacts.html" adhocenable="false">Graduate Program Assistant</a>&nbsp;to find out how to make corrections. It is important for this information to be correct, as the wrong degree may block you from entering courses for which you are eligible.</p>
</li>
<li><h5><b>Address Verification</b></h5>
<p>On this screen, you will see your current address. Follow the instructions if you wish to correct your address, or continue to the next step. Please note you are responsible for providing the University with your current mailing address. You are required to fulfill all financial and administrative obligations within the prescribed deadlines regardless of the validity of your address in our files.</p>
</li>
<li><h5><b>Registration Status</b></h5>
<p>On this screen, you will see a list of the courses for which you have already registered in the current academic year. Your options will be to add a course, make a section change, or drop a course.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>It is extremely important that you complete each transaction by using the confirmation button. Neglecting to do this will result in the transaction being cancelled.</p>
<h3>Adding courses</h3>
<ol>
<li>Choose “add a course? and select your course by entering the course name and number.</li>
<li>The course you selected will appear on a course search result screen. Additional information such as special topic, prerequisite(s), course notes and summer term dates are available by clicking the details button.</li>
<li>After you have selected the course to add, a confirmation of selection screen will ask you to confirm your selection.</li>
<li>Following confirmation, a screen will inform you if registration has been approved or denied. If registration is denied, a reason will be provided.</li>
</ol>
<p>If a course has reached its registration limit, you will be offered the possibility to view other sections of that course that might be available to you. If there are none, select another course. Don’t forget, however, that students will be adding and dropping courses throughout the year and places may become free. You will have ample opportunity to add or drop courses and make any other changes you wish until the add/drop deadline.</p>
<p>If you wish to register for course(s) not listed in the available courses, please contact your&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/program-contacts.html" adhocenable="false">Graduate Program Assistant</a>.</p>
<p>Note for Master/PhD students: Registration regulations state that Master and PhD students must maintain continuous registration. If you are not taking a course each term, a notation “Continuing in Program? will be reflected on your record. Please refer to&nbsp;<a href="/admissions/tuition-fees.html" adhocenable="false">Tuition and Fees</a>&nbsp;for detailed information.</p>
<p>Remember to register for both Fall and Winter courses at the same time – do not wait until later in the Fall to register for your Winter courses as you may find them filled to capacity.</p>
<h3>Course Section changes</h3>
<p>If there are multiple sections of a particular course, the section change function allows you to verify the availability of another section of the same course before you make a decision. There is, therefore, no risk of losing the section you have if another section is not available. DO NOT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, use the drop and add features to accomplish a section change. If you drop the section that you are currently registered for and then find out that no spaces are available in other sections, you may not be able to get back into the section you were originally registered in as another student may have taken your place once you dropped the course.</p>
<ol>
<li>Select “Section Change? next to the course in which you wish to make a change of section.</li>
<li>A screen will appear listing all other sections of the same course. If you find one you wish to enter, press the Change button.</li>
<li>Either confirm or cancel the action by clicking the appropriate button. If you cancel the action, you will be returned to the Results of Course Change Search screen. If you choose Confirm Change, the system will approve or deny the section change. If approved, you will be added to the section chosen and dropped from the other. Confirmation of the change will be displayed on the Course Section Change Approved screen. You will then be able to return to the Registration Status screen where the new section will be listed.</li>
</ol>
<p>Please note:&nbsp;Once the last date for registration has passed, you may not make section changes.</p>
<h3>Dropping courses</h3>
<p>Please note:&nbsp;If you only want to change sections of the same course use the “Section Change? function.</p>
<p>Dropping a course means you have decided you no longer wish to remain registered in it. There are two types of course withdrawals and both are controlled by deadline dates shown in&nbsp;<a href="/students/academic-resources/graduate-academic-dates.html" adhocenable="false">Term Dates and Deadlines</a>:</p>
<ul>
<li><b>DNE (did not enter)</b>&nbsp;– The DNE date is generally one to two weeks after the first day of classes. A withdrawal (drop) before the DNE deadline date is treated as if you were never in the course. There will be no entry on your student record for that course and you will not be charged tuition and other fees for that course. If you have already paid for the course, you will receive financial credit for course fees.&nbsp;Please note:&nbsp;Students in Masters/PhD programs will continue to be billed tuition and other fees for the term unless they DNE for all courses in the term and request a leave of absence.<br>
<br>
</li>
<li><b>DISC (discontinue)</b>&nbsp;– The DISC date is later in the term. A withdrawal (drop) after the DNE date, but before the DISC deadline date allows you to stop attending that course with no academic penalty. Unlike the DNE, however, the course will remain on your student record with an entry of DISC and you will be held financially responsible for the payment of 100% of tuition and other fees, including the Winter term of a full-year course (/3).</li>
</ul>
<p>If you attempt to DNE or DISC a course that is a co-requisite or prerequisite to another course for which you have registered, you will not be permitted to do so until you also drop the second course.</p>
<p>Choose “Drop? next to the course you wish to drop.</p>
<ul>
<li>Confirm the action. If yourrequest to drop a course has been accepted a confirmation of course dropscreen will appear showing the details and asking you to confirm yourselection by clicking the “Confirm Drop? or “Don’t Drop? button. You will be returned to the Registration Status screen where your course will no longer be shown if the course was dropped before the DNE deadline. After the DNE deadline and before the DISC deadline, the notation DISC will appear beside the course you have confirmed to drop.</li>
</ul>
<p>Please note:&nbsp;Not attending classes, or informing an instructor of the intent to withdraw, does not constitute official withdrawal, nor does it entitle a student to a refund of fees or cancellation of registration. Without formally dropping the course by the appropriate academic withdrawal deadline, non-attendance of a class will result in the assignment of a failing grade. If a graduate student no longer wishes to continue in the program they must complete the notice of&nbsp;<a href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/sgs/docs/forms/noticeofwithdrawal.pdf" adhocenable="false">withdrawal from graduate program form</a>&nbsp;and submit it to the Graduate Program Director Master and PhD students who do not formally withdraw will continue to billed fees.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="text-align: right;"><a adhocenable="false" href="#top">Back to top</a></p>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

	        <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Academic regulations</h1>
</div></div>
<div class="section tabs">










    <script type="text/javascript">
	$ = jQuery;
	$(document).ready(function() {
	    $('#tabs a:first').tab('show');
	    var hash = window.location.hash;
	    if (hash == undefined || hash == ""){
	      var previouslyActive = getCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab");
          if (previouslyActive != undefined) hash = previouslyActive;
	    }
	    hash && $('ul.nav a[href="' + hash + '"]').tab('show');

	    $('.nav-tabs a').click(function (e) {
	        $(this).tab('show');
	        var scrollmem = $('body').scrollTop();
	        window.location.hash = this.hash;
	        $('html,body').scrollTop(scrollmem);
	        setCookie("concordia-component-tab-active-tab", this.hash, 1);
	    });
	});
        /** COOKIE GETTER AND SETTER FUNCTIONS **/
    function setCookie(c_name,value,exdays){
        var exdate=new Date();
        exdate.setDate(exdate.getDate() + exdays);
        var c_value=escape(value) + ((exdays==null) ? "" : "; expires="+exdate.toUTCString());
        document.cookie=c_name + "=" + c_value;
    }
    function getCookie(c_name){
      var c_value=document.cookie;
      var c_start=c_value.indexOf(" " + c_name + "=");
      if (c_start == -1)	{
        c_start=c_value.indexOf(c_name + "=");
      }
      if (c_start == -1){
        c_value=null;
      } else {
        c_start=c_value.indexOf("=", c_start) + 1;
        var c_end=c_value.indexOf(";", c_start);
        if (c_end == -1){
          c_end=c_value.length;
        }
        c_value=unescape(c_value.substring(c_start,c_end));
      }
      return c_value;
    }
	</script>
	
	<div class="c-tabs">
    
	    <ul class="nav nav-tabs" id="tabs">
	        
		          <li><a href="#undergraduate" data-toggle="tab">Undergraduate</a></li>
		        
	        
		          <li><a href="#graduate" data-toggle="tab">Graduate</a></li>
		        
	        
	    </ul>
	    <div class="tab-content">
	        <div class="tab-pane" id="undergraduate">
	           
	           <div class="parsys parsys-tabs-0">


<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt1"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt1-c0 span9 paddingRight rightSeparator "><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><br>
The Undergraduate Calendar contains everything you need to know about being a student at Concordia. Its length can be a challenge, but remember that not all of it applies to you, considering that it includes descriptions of all programs and courses offered at the university.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>Section 16 of the Undergraduate Calendar</b>&nbsp;contains the rules and regulations pertaining to definitions and regulations that relate to academics at Concordia.</p>
<p>We’ve provided this page as a handy reference so you can quickly find the information you need.&nbsp;Below, you can find brief definitions and links to information about Concordia's credit system, how to calculate your GPA, the definition of full-time status, how to withdraw from a course and a lot more.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item open">
        <a name="general"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open General regulations">
					
                    General regulations
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: block;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.1.1">Academic Year</a>&nbsp;defines Concordia’s academic year, when it begins and its semesters of study.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.1.2">Credit System</a>&nbsp;defines a university credit and how credits relate to full-time or part-time student status.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.1.3">Residence Requirements</a>&nbsp;defines the number of credits that you must take <b>at Concordia</b> to fulfill a degree’s requirements.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.1.5">Cancellation of Classes</a>&nbsp;declares when a class is considered cancelled without notification.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="#"></a><a name="withdrawals"></a><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#">Withdrawal</a> outlines the regulations that concern a student’s withdrawal from a course or the university.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.1.7">Studies at Other Universities</a> specifies the procedures, regulations and deadlines you must follow if you wish to take courses at another university in Quebec, in Canada or abroad.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.1.8">Student Request Committees</a>&nbsp;evaluate a student’s request to be exempted from specific academic regulations. These exceptions cover requests such as permission for course overloads, course substitutions or course registration or withdrawal after the deadline. This section defines the members of the Student Request Committee, the types of requests and the deadline to submit them.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="curriculum"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Curriculum regulations">
					
                    Curriculum regulations
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.2.1">Modifications to Academic Programs and Regulations</a> defines the university’s right to modify or phase out degree programs, as well as its responsibilities to students registered in those programs.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.2.2">Degree Regulations</a> refers you to the degree requirements for each Faculty.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.2.3">Concentration Requirements</a>: Every undergraduate program requires a cohesive sequence of courses. This section defines the number of credits required to complete an honours, specialization or major within the university’s undergraduate programs.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="curriculum"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Evaluation, grading system, examinations, and performance requirements">
					
                    Evaluation, grading system, examinations, and performance requirements
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_1" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.1">Evaluation</a> declares that instructors will evaluate student performance through assignments, tests, level of participation, exams and other methods and activities. This section also specifies the deadlines for instructors to submit final grades.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.2">Language of Instruction and Examinations</a>&nbsp;specifies that courses at Concordia University are normally taught in English. This section also informs students that they may write assignments and examinations in French if they prefer, and how to make this request.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.3">Grading System</a> defines the letter grades used by the university and their respective grade points.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.4">All administrative Notations</a> defines the university’s notations used on transcript to describe various circumstances of a student’s participation in a course or exam such as DEF, MED, PEND, RPT, WRKT and more.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.6">Late completion of courses</a>:&nbsp;If you are in a situation that will interfere with the completion of coursework, you can ask for permission to submit any assignments after the course deadline. This section defines the procedure you must follow to make such a request.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.7">In Progress (IP)</a> notations defines the circumstances when an instructor may submit an IP (in progress) notation. The section also specifies when the student must submit or complete the work.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.9">Academic Re-evaluation</a>&nbsp;describes the process to follow if&nbsp;you feel that you received an unfair grade and want to ask the university to re-evaluate your course work. Though this <b>process should be considered as a last resort</b>, this section outlines the steps you must take, your responsibilities, the deadlines to submit your request, and how to file an appeal of a decision.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.10">Examinations</a>&nbsp;describes the procedures for centrally administred examinations, including deferred, replacement, and supplmental.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.11">Academic Performance</a> describes how the university calculates your grade point average (GPA).</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.12">High Academic Achievement</a>&nbsp;defines the university’s criteria for granting degrees “With Distinction? or “With Great Distinction?.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current/sec16/16.html#b16.3.13">Repetition of Courses</a> describes when a student may repeat a course.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt1-c1 span3"><div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase textimage section">



<div class="image " id="cq-textimage-jsp-/content/concordia/en/students/regulations/jcr:content/content-main/tabs/parsys-tabs-0/textimage" style="width:auto;"><img title="related-office" alt="related-office" class="cq-dd-image" src="/content/concordia/en/students/regulations/_jcr_content/content-main/tabs/parsys-tabs-0/textimage/image.img.png/1384709604819.png"></div>

        }
        
    })();
</script>
        <div class="rte"><div class="text"><h3>Connect with us</h3>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/offices/registrar.html">Office of the Registrar</a></p>
</div></div>
<div class="clear"></div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase picker section">






<div class="c-bloc-relatedlinks bloc">
            <h2 class="section-header">Related Resources</h2>
		    <ul>
		        
						        <li>
						            <a href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar/current.html">
						                <i class="sprites-icon-arrow-right-black"></i>
						                Undergraduate Course Calendar
						            </a>
						        </li>
		                     
						        <li>
						            <a href="http://vpexternalsecgen.concordia.ca/documents/policies/AcademicCodeConduct2008.pdf">
						                <i class="sprites-icon-arrow-right-black"></i>
						                Academic Code of Conduct
						            </a>
						        </li>
		                     
						        <li>
						            <a href="/students/academic-integrity.html">
						                <i class="sprites-icon-arrow-right-black"></i>
						                Academic integrity
						            </a>
						        </li>
		                     
		    </ul>
	    </div><hr> </div>
</div></div><div style="clear:both"></div>

</div>

	        </div>
	        <div class="tab-pane" id="graduate">
	           
	           <div class="parsys parsys-tabs-1">


<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt1"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt1-c0 span9 paddingRight rightSeparator "><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Students are responsible for being familiar with the rules and regulations concerning graduate registration and with Academic regulations. This information is available in the&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current/graduate-registration.html" adhocenable="false">Graduate Registration</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current/academic-regulations.html" adhocenable="false">Academic Regulations</a>&nbsp;sections of the Graduate Calendar.</p>
<p>The deadlines for registering and dropping courses can be found in the&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current/academic-calendar.html" adhocenable="false">Academic Calendar</a>&nbsp;section of the Calendar. Students are responsible for meeting these deadlines. If a student has not met these deadlines due to circumstances beyond their control, they may submit a Student Request through their&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/program-contacts.html" adhocenable="false">department</a>.</p>
<h2>Graduate Academic Standing</h2>
<p>The academic performance of graduate students is monitored on a periodic basis. Academic performance is based on different factors including GPA, C&nbsp;grades, F&nbsp;grades, PhD progress reports. Please note some programs may have more stringent requirements than those listed in the general section of the Graduate Calendar. Please refer to the information in the calendar on&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current/academic-regulations.html#academicstanding" adhocenable="false">Academic Standing</a>.</p>
<p>The grades for Concordia graduate courses transferred into a graduate program now appear on the student record and transcript and are calculated in the Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA). This helps in addressing the concerns expressed by students that their CGPA does not reflect their actual performance. For further information please contact your program or the School of Graduate Studies.</p>
<h2>Academic Code of Conduct</h2>
<p>The integrity of University academic life and of the degrees, diplomas and certificates the University confers is dependent upon the honesty and soundness of the instructor-student learning relationship and, in particular, that of the evaluation process. As such, all students are expected to be honest in all of their academic endeavours and relationships with the University.</p>
<p>For further information visit the&nbsp;<a href="/students/academic-integrity.html" adhocenable="false">Academic Integrity</a>&nbsp;section&nbsp;or go directly to the&nbsp;<a href="http://vpexternalsecgen.concordia.ca/documents/policies/AcademicCodeConduct2008.pdf">Academic Code of Conduct</a>.</p>
<h2>Graduate Academic Appeals Procedure</h2>
<p>Graduate students are entitled to appeal decisions which affect their academic standing. It is assumed that initiating an appeal is the last recourse. Please review the&nbsp;<a href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/sgs/docs/student-affairs/GAAT.pdf" adhocenable="false">appeal procedures</a>&nbsp;for detailed information.</p>
<h2>Graduate Re-evaluation</h2>
<p>It is the right of students to request a re-evaluation of coursework which includes tests, examinations, essays and other work that contributed to the grading of a course. For details on the process please review the&nbsp;<a href="/academics/graduate/calendar/current/policies-procedures.html" adhocenable="false">Academic Re-evaluation procedures</a>.</p>

</div></div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt1-c1 span3"><div class="parbase textimage section">



<div class="image " id="cq-textimage-jsp-/content/concordia/en/students/regulations/jcr:content/content-main/tabs/parsys-tabs-1/textimage" style="width:auto;"><img title="related-office" alt="related-office" class="cq-dd-image" src="/content/concordia/en/students/regulations/_jcr_content/content-main/tabs/parsys-tabs-1/textimage/image.img.png/1384709612058.png"></div>

<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/offices/sgs.html">School of Graduate Studies</a></p>
</div></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    
    <div class="container">

                    	<span class="sprites-icon-social-1" displayText="Facebook" st_image='http://www.concordia.ca/content/concordia/en/admissions/tuition-fees/fee-payment-deadlines/methods-of-payment.img.png/1376486708209.png'>Facebook</span>
                    </a>
                </li>
                <li>
                    <a href="#" title="Twitter" class="st_twitter_custom">
                    	<span class="sprites-icon-social-2" displayText="Twitter" st_image='http://www.concordia.ca/content/concordia/en/admissions/tuition-fees/fee-payment-deadlines/methods-of-payment.img.png/1376486708209.png'>Twitter</span>
                    </a>
                </li>
                <li>
                    <a href="#" title="LinkedIn" class="st_linkedin_custom">
                        <span class="sprites-icon-social-5" displayText="LinkedIn" st_image='http://www.concordia.ca/content/concordia/en/admissions/tuition-fees/fee-payment-deadlines/methods-of-payment.img.png/1376486708209.png'>LinkedIn</span>
                    </a>
                </li>
            </ul>
